snippet: Eamonn Coghlan, a seven-time winner of the Wanamaker Mile, will be present at the Millrose Games, which will be held Saturday for the first time at the Armory in Upper Manhattan.
abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column on Upper Manhattan's Armory becoming host of the Millrose Games for the first time; says move from Madison Square Garden is kosher because the track at the Garden is 11 laps to the mile, turning runners into hamsters on a wheel, the banked track at the Armory is eight laps to the mile, making it possible for world-level athletes to turn in times that reflect their ability.
lead_paragraph: Eamonn Coghlan, a seven-time winner of the Wanamaker Mile, will be present at the Millrose Games, which will be held Saturday for the first time at the Armory in Upper Manhattan.

headline.seo: Millrose Games Move Into New Era
headline.main: From Good Times at the Garden to a New Era at the Armory
headline.print_headline: From Good Times at the Garden to a New Era at the Armory
